page.title: 04Peterborough's History
page.content:
People have been settling in and around the city for the past 6000 years. After the stone age came Roman farmers and then the Anglo-Saxons.
A Saxon monastery was founded 1300 years ago and this became the cathedral on its dissolution during the reign of Henry VIII.
The growth of the city was slow until 136 years ago when the railways came and plunged Peterborough into its first expansion and made the city an engineering centre.
Now, in 1985, the city is just coming to the end of its second expansion. This time it has been a planned growth with careful attention to industry, employment, housing and leisure.
